examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
The bad weather brought famine.
Don’t use bad language.
Bad manners will get you nowhere.
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is unsatisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng không thỏa mãn

examples: She hasn't passed her driving test yet.
He hasn’t passed his driving test yet.
The policeman hammered home the dangers of drinking and driving.
All that driving has given me a headache.
She passed her driving test with flying colors - she got a perfect score!
words.defineEn: the act of controlling the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: hành động kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: Don't make a habit of it.
The toddler imitated his mother's habit of biting her nails.
Lying is considered a bad habit.
Laura has a habit of rubbing people the wrong way.
She gave me a flea in my ear over my spending habits.
words.defineEn: something that you regularly do almost without thinking about it, particularly one that is hard to give up or stop doing
words.defineVi: điều gì đó mà bạn thường xuyên làm hầu như không nghĩ về nó, đặc biệt là điều khó từ bỏ hoặc ngừng làm

examples: Hold your speed at 70.
The speed limit on this road is sixty kilometers per hour.
The fast roller coaster thrilled riders with its speed.
The speed limit on this highway is ninety kilometers per hour.
He threw those kicks at lightning speed!
words.defineEn: the rate or pace at which something or someone moves
words.defineVi: tốc độ hoặc tốc độ mà một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó di chuyển

examples: Robots weld a tailgate to the body.
Don't tailgate.
You tailgate for four years.
You know, you get the good old tailgate.
It offers users better functionality by adding five additional configurations to the primary tailgate function.
words.defineEn: the rear door of a car, truck, or van that can be opened downwards when loading or unloading goods
words.defineVi: cửa sau của ô tô, xe tải hoặc xe van có thể mở xuống khi bốc dỡ hàng hóa

examples: My wife talked sense into me.
Your friend really talks a blue streak!
The two men talked.
A true leader walks the talk.
He talked a blue streak all through breakfast.
words.defineEn: to tell someone about the information, feelings, or ideas that we have
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó về thông tin, cảm xúc hoặc ý tưởng mà chúng tôi có

examples: Will you get the phone?
Your phone is ringing for the thousandth time.
The phone rang and broke my train of thought.
I have my phone to thank for my lack of sleep last night.
The phone lead isn’t long enough to reach the bedroom.
words.defineEn: an electronic device used to talk to a person who is at a different location
words.defineVi: một thiết bị điện tử được sử dụng để nói chuyện với một người đang ở một địa điểm khác

examples: The text runs along the margin of the page.
When designing a website or presentation, it's important to use visuals to break up text and convey information in a more engaging way - after all, a picture is worth a thousand words.

The student struggled with a challenging book, but knew that every book must be chewed to get out its juice - it was essential to persevere and put in the effort to understand and appreciate the text.
Most people always just text.
- Text a doctor.
words.defineEn: to send a written message using a cell phone
words.defineVi: để gửi một tin nhắn bằng văn bản sử dụng một điện thoại di động

examples: When overwhelmed with coding, my mentor advised me to start writing basic programs even if they were imperfect, saying 'begin to weave and God will give the thread.'
It weaves a ball of silk on a branch.
As Ethic weaves her way towards the innermost maze, her radio picks up a transmission.
Next, colorful thread is painstakingly woven into the bed of warp.
Indigenous people in South America were weaving hats long before the Spaniards arrived in the 1500s.
words.defineEn: to continuously change directions while moving to avoid colliding with things or people that are in the way
words.defineVi: liên tục đổi hướng trong khi di chuyển để tránh va chạm với đồ vật hoặc người cản đường

examples: Every day about noon, traffic in town grinds to a halt.
to control the traffic congestion
You can hear the traffic from your room day and night.
Priority is given to traffic already on the roundabout.
The new traffic system worked up to a point, but it had its problems.
words.defineEn: the coming and going of cars, airplanes, etc. in an area at a particular time
words.defineVi: sự đến và đi của ô tô, máy bay, v.v. trong một khu vực vào một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: My watch has stopped.
The buck stops with him.
The car stopped at the traffic lights.
The team stopped the rot with a 5–0 win last night.
Doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.

words.defineEn: a signal that informs drivers that they must stop their vehicles
words.defineVi: một tín hiệu thông báo cho người lái xe rằng họ phải dừng xe của họ

examples: The dark clouds signaled that rain was on its way.
The scent of wild cherry blossoms filled the air, signaling the arrival of spring.
The clock struck eleven times, signaling the start of the event.
She holds her finger to her lips, signaling for silence.
The interneurons in the spinal cord help to relay signals from sensory neurons to motor neurons, allowing for coordinated movements.
words.defineEn: to give someone a message, instruction, etc. by making a sound or movement
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó một tin nhắn, hướng dẫn, v.v. bằng cách tạo ra âm thanh hoặc chuyển động

examples: After months of job searching, the recent graduate was about to give up hope, but remembering that it is a long lane that has no turning encouraged her to keep trying, and eventually she landed her dream job.
The turning of the blades spins coils of wire inside a magnetic field, producing a steady supply of electricity.
The turning blades power machinery in nearby turbines to generate electricity.
And the turning radius is just way too big for like weaving in between people.
Time went on in Coketown like the turning of its machines.
words.defineEn: the action of changing directions in a course
words.defineVi: hành động thay đổi hướng trong một khóa học

examples: The days passed slowly.
The time passed quickly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Unemployment has now passed the three million mark.
words.defineEn: to approach a specific place, object, or person and move past them
words.defineVi: để tiếp cận một địa điểm cụ thể, đối tượng, hoặc người và di chuyển qua chúng

words.defineEn: an area where people can leave their cars or other vehicles for a period of time
words.defineVi: một khu vực mà mọi người có thể rời khỏi xe ô tô của họ hoặc các phương tiện khác trong một khoảng thời gian
